title: Tower of Voices
listingDescription: The Tower of Voices is a ninety-three foot tall musical instrument holding forty wind chimes, representing the forty passengers and crew members. This landmark feature is visible from US Route 30/Lincoln Highway and is powered by the wind blowing through the memorial.

images.title: Tower of Voices
images.caption: Tower of Voices in a meadow of yellow tickseed.

bodyText:
The Tower of Voices is a momumental, ninety-three foot tall musical instrument holding forty wind chimes, represtenting the forty passengers and crew members. It is intended to be a landmark feature near the memorial entrance, visable from US Route 30/Lincoln Highway. The Tower of Voices provides a living memorial in sound to remember the forty through the sybolic voices as the wind blows.

There are no other chime structures like the Tower of Voices in the world. The shape and orientation of the tower are designed to optimize air flow through the tower walls. The chime system is designed using music theory to identify a mathmetically developed range of frequencies needed to produce musical notes.

quickFacts.value: Near the entrance of Flight 93 National Memorial
quickFacts.name: Location

quickFacts.value: The only wind chime tower like it in the world. Contains one chime for each passenger and crew member. Chimes are activated by the wind.
quickFacts.name: Significance
